item.title: Report E-2024010152
item.description:
Report E-2024010152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of uN266 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one-quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews downstacked the pallet, removed one (1) leaking 5-gallon pail of UN3266 corrosive liquid from the load, and placed it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted trailer and swept them up with hand tools. Crews then wiped down the impacted surfaces and freight with a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into the one (1) 35-gallon drum, and both 35-gallon drums generated during this cleanup were staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024010123
item.description:
Report E-2024010123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 4, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1219 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one-halt (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail, all UN1219 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal purposes by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2024010358
item.description:
Report X-2024010358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report E-2023120420
item.description:
Report E-2023120420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 70ft-by-20ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that seventy (70) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area while on SCBA and later respirators and later once the neutralizing had been completed an absorbent was used to gather the spent material. Hepaco personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged 275-gallon poly tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55- gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010112
item.description:
Report X-2024010112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-31
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING ON THE BELT IN DATA ACQUISITION. USING THE DECISION TREE, FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE AND RELATED SPILL WERE PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRUB AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
